text:
When I try to start the http service, then it will give an error message like 
this:
shkcorpws6# ../bin/apachectl startssl
ld.so.1: /usr/local/apache2/bin/rotatelogs: fatal: libgcc_s.so.1: open failed: 
No such file or directory

(the service is up, but it can't work properly)
creator: leo.foo@gmail.com

text:
You can set LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/path/to/directory/containing/libgcc (or use similar
techniques; man ld.so.1), or build gcc with --disable-shared to avoid this.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
ISTR that this is broken with 2.0 because environment variables aren't passed
through to piped loggers (the apr cmdtype issue listed in STATUS for eons).
creator: trawick@apache.org
jorton@redhat.com
text: Sorry, I keep forgetting about that.

See bug 33696 which references Jeff's fix for this issue.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 33696 ***
creator: jorton@redhat.com
